Topological Charge of ADHM Instanton on
R2NC × R2
Yu Tian
Institute of Theoretical Physics, Chinese Academy of Sciences
P. O. Box 2735, Beijing 100080, China
ytian@itp.ac.cn
September 5, 2018

Abstract
We have calculated the topological charge of U (N ) instantons on
non-degenerate noncommutative space time to be exactly the instanton
number k in a previous paper [1]. This paper, which deals with the
degenerate R2NC × R2 case, is the continuation of [1]. We find that the
same conclusion holds in this case, thus complete the answer to the
problem of topological charge of noncommutative U (N ) instantons.

1

 In a previous article [1], we have explicitly shown that the topological
charge of U (N ) instantons on non-degenerate noncommutative space time1
R4NC is equal to the instanton number k, which appears in the noncommutative ADHM construction [6] as the dimension of the vector space V .
There we left the problem of degenerate noncommutative parameter θ. We
mentioned that our method ceased to work in the limit of θ2 → 0 because
of the loss of a Fock space representation for z2 and z̄2 .2
In this degenerate limit, the noncommutative space time becomes a direct product R2NC × R2 . It is well known that field theories on R4NC suffer
from a common problem of non-unitarity. But the problem does not happen
on R2NC × R2 if we require a time in the commutative part. For this reason,
R2NC × R2 may be of more physical relevance than R4NC . Literature has also
shown that nonsingular ADHM instanton solutions can be constructed on
R2NC × R2 without involving any projected states [7, 8].
In the following paragraphs, we will analytically calculate the topological
charge of U (N ) instantons on R2NC × R2 . As the continuation of [1], this
paper will be brief about the relevant background and rely on some results
in [1].
